file_content.text: The resistance may still pull through because of you--and thank you for listening.
The supply cache! And it's mostly intact--oh, thank you. I'll see the resistance gets it before I... before I leave.
I was supposed to help the resistance and I failed. That can't happen again. I'm returning to Tython; I can't do any more harm there.
Think how much good one Jedi could do on Corellia--especially a Jedi who's really learned from her mistake.
But you're needed here.
I... well, I have been thinking over what I would have done differently. And we have the supplies... I could try again.
That seems like a good idea.
The Council will be disappointed, I'm sure, but I must follow my feelings.
Enough melodrama.
I'll be sure to... meditate on that.
Thank you again for your help. Here, I never had a chance to use this against the Imperials. No doubt you'll have the opportunity.
What good am I really doing here if I couldn't even keep those supplies safe?
The Imperials bomb Corellia, attack civilians, turn our leaders against us. And now they're stealing from us, too?
Forgive me. I should be setting an example, I know. But who'd want me as a role model?
The Empire found one of our supply caches and started looting it. I couldn't stop them; I almost died trying. Those supplies were for the Corellian resistance. I failed them.
Such events test our resolve. Stay strong and learn from this.
Don't give in to despair.
Others shouldn't suffer just so I can learn a lesson.
We can't predict consequences.
But that's not good enough, I should have been better, or faster, or--something.
Don't blame yourself. You did your duty.
No, it's the Empire's fault.
My duty is to stop the Empire and help the Corellians. I've failed at both.
You Jedi don't have it easy.
It certainly brings up certain... questions for me. But those must wait.
How are your injuries?
I'll live. But I should have died fighting, if it meant stopping the Imperials.
Life isn't fair.
That supply cache had medicine, emergency barricades, shield emitters. The Corellian resistance could make a fortified position if I got them back.
But I can't. They need those supplies, but the Imperials will just cut me down if I go after them.
Let me get them.
That's... a very noble offer.
I'm not afraid of them.
Then you're bolder than I am.
Thank you. The resistance shouldn't suffer because of my failure. I'll be waiting for you.
Train harder. [Refuse quest]
Then those supplies are as good as lost.
This is hopeless.
